name: Mobility for Prosperity in Europe
goal: The purpose of the Association is to promote transport systems in Europe that correspond to usersâ€™ choices, that are subject to free, undistorted competition and which do not receive any public money except that within justified limits; which contribute to the economic prosperity of the Union and ensure a high quality of life for its population
interests: Climate Action, Competition, Consumers, Customs, Digital economy and society, Economy, finance and the euro, Education and training, Employment and Social Affairs, Energy, Environment, Regional Policy, Research and innovation, Single market, Taxation, Trade, Trans-European Networks, Transport
euInitiatives: Any piece of legislation related to road transport to which transport stakeholders (such as associations and large companies which make extensive use of transports in their operations) could positively contribute in order to achieve EU goals on safety, sustainability, connectivity and digitalisation.
